title.narrative: Rural Education and Development (READ) Project (formerly Rural Education Support Project)

description.narrative: The objective of the project is to assist the Recipient in enhancing the quality of education in rural primary schools, grades 1-5, by improving students' access to, and use of, quality learning materials and improving teachers' skills through promoting professional networks.

condition.narrative: An independent audit firm, acceptable to IDA, to undertake audits of project accounts, will be appointed by December 31, 2006.
Implementation of the project will be carried out in a manner consistent with the Berne Convention on copyright protection towhichM ongolia is a signatory.
Maintenance of the PMU under terms of reference acceptable to IDA; the PMU will maintain adequate facilities and staff and belocate d in the MECS complex during the life of the project.
The Recipient should have its financial statement audited and furnish the report to the Bank not later than six months after theend of one fiscal year after the recipient.

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level

comment.narrative: Mongolia currently has a national examination at end of basic education. However, every school set its own examination. MECS iscurrently considering reforming this system in light of its Cambridge curricular reform.

title.narrative: Classroom libraries established in 4029 grade 1-5 classrooms in 383 schools

comment.narrative: No more classroom libraries will be delivered.

actual.value: 3520 classroom ibraries were established in 391 schools.

comment.narrative: Because of grade-skipping due to structural change of the education system, the number of classrooms was fewer than the originaltarget but the number of schools covered exceeded the target.

title.narrative: 150 new children's books will be selected to be available in rural schools

comment.narrative: Target met and exceeded.

title.narrative: Students from nationally representative sample of schools participate in National Assessment of Student Progress for Mongolian language and mathematics

comment.narrative: Task completed.
Task completed.

title.narrative: 315 primary teachers from core schools trained in literacy development and use of reading materials as well as supported as peer mentors

comment.narrative: Two mentors from each core school were trained, as well as mentors from satellite schools. Target exceeded.
Implemented. But data quality was poor, resulting in Mongolia was included in IEA's final report.

title.narrative: Students in grades 1-5 bagh and soum schools will increase their reading time in class and demonstrate improvements in their literacy skills.

comment.narrative: No further impact evaluation will be carried out.
Target of 100% increase in reading time was met according to the impact evaluation.
Task completed and target exceeded.

title.narrative: Number of additional qualified primary teachers resulting from project interventions.

comment.narrative: Task completed
4000 were targeted, but that number was exceeded.

title.narrative: Utility of the learning assessment system
Schools received computers with international children's digital libraru (ICDL)

comment.narrative: 5 schools were reached, but less than 25 computers for each school. There was no space for more computers in the schools.

title.narrative: Implementation of field test of TIMSS/PIRLS

comment.narrative: Survey was not allowed to be implemented by a Ministerial decision.
Completed on time.
Due to overestimation of the number of classrooms to receive maps, the actual number of maps delivered was correspondingly reduced.

READ covers all rural schools in 3 phases. The design is to use as "control group" schools that were scheduled to receive inputsinlater years and compare student performance with the pilot schools (treatment group). After the roll out of the project in allruralschools, there is no more control group to do subsequent comparison.
Same reason as before.
Target Met

title.narrative: 2000 students along with teachers and directors have received netbook computers connected to servers with customized ICDL software

comment.narrative: Targets met.
Task completed.

target.value: Survey data are supposed to be collected, analyzed and reported to IEA, MECS and World Bank.

comment.narrative: Due to the cancellation of the survey, data were not collected.
The findings were reported to MECS and the World Bank.

title.narrative: 5 hours of usage per week of netbooks by students

comment.narrative: To be confirmed by an impact evaluation

title.narrative: 5 hours of usage per week of netbooks by teachers

comment.narrative: To be confirmed by impact evaluation
